main event: An unidentified flying object was observed and tracked by radar during a military flight over Charlotte Islands, Canada on 28 August 1959.
interesting points: The object exhibited erratic motion, moving behind trees and hovering in place., Captain Wolter's aircraft was the only one in formation that detected the object on radar., The beacon on the object was red and appeared to be in the same position as the radar targets., Multiple crew members reported various radar returns, some of which were believed to be reflected returns from other aircraft., The total observation time for the object was approximately 45 minutes, with multiple radar contacts at varying distances.
sighted object: an unidentified flying object with a rotating red beacon
witnesses: military crew members aboard the aircraft
